Subsection.Text: The department and customers served by the department shall periodically review the qualifications of subscribers using the state SUNCOM Network and terminate services provided to a facility not qualified under this part or rules adopted hereunder. In the event of nonpayment of invoices by subscribers whose SUNCOM Network invoices are paid from sources other than legislative appropriations, such nonpayment represents good and sufficient reason to terminate service.

The department shall adopt rules for implementing and operating the state SUNCOM Network, which include procedures for withdrawing and restoring authorization to use the state SUNCOM Network. Such rules shall provide a minimum of 30 days’ notice to affected parties before terminating voice communications service.
This section does not limit or restrict the ability of the Florida Public Service Commission to set jurisdictional tariffs of telecommunications companies.
